p: Bacterial infection was identified in 63 (32.31%) of the 195 patients. The two frequently detected bacteria were A. baumannii and K. pneumoniae, which accounting for 49.21% of the bacterial infection. In addition, there were 7 cases infected by P. aeruginosa and S. aureus, respectively, and 6 cases were E. coli ( Table 4). Three cases had more than one bacterial infection, which was S. aureus plus K. ornithinolytica, A. baumannii plus P. aeruginosa and S. pneumoniae plus E. aerogenes, respectively.
